alert.note: Alert for Lower Washington County; South Central Utah; Zion National Park (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 31 at 8:32PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Washington County through 915 PM MDT... At 829 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southeast of Virgin River Campground, or 8 miles southeast of Virgin River Gorge, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... St George, Washington, Hurricane, Santa Clara, La Verkin, Dameron Valley, Quail Creek State Park, Sand Hollow State Park, Gunlock State Park, Ivins, Toquerville, Leeds, Virgin, Motoqua, Pintura, Bloomington, Gunlock, Veyo, Snow Canyon State Park and Goldstrike. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 1 and 33. Utah Route 18 between mile markers 0 and 23. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. Locally heavy rainfall is also possible with these storms, and could lead to ponding of water on roadways. Reduce driving speeds.
